info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Grady, southwestern Lincoln, southern Oklahoma, Cleveland, southeastern Canadian, northwestern Pottawatomie and northwestern McClain Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 844 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Chandler to near Bridge Creek. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, Newcastle, Blanchard, Mustang, Choctaw, Noble, Tuttle, Harrah, McLoud, Spencer, Jones, Nicoma Park, Prague, Pink and Goldsby. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 101 and 133. Interstate 40 between mile markers 145 and 190. Interstate 44 between mile markers 97 and 121, and between mile markers 144 and 162. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
